question: A and B working separately can do a piece of work in 9 and 15 days respectively. If they work for a day alternately, with A beginning, then the work will be complete in :
explanation:
A\'s 1 day\'s work $latex = \\frac{1}{9}&s=1$
B\'s 1 day\'s work $latex = \\frac{1}{15}&s=1$
Work done in first 2 days = A\'s 1 day\'s work + B\'s 1 day\'s work 
$latex = \\frac{1}{9}+\\frac{1}{15} = \\frac{5+3}{45} = \\frac{8}{45}&s=1$
∴ Work done in first 10 days $latex = \\frac{8\\times 5}{45} = \\frac{8}{9}&s=1$
Remaining work $latex  = 1-\\frac{8}{9} = \\frac{1}{9}&s=1$
Now it is turn of \'A\' for the eleventh day.
∴ Time taken by \'A\' in doing $latex \\frac{1}{9}&s=1$ work $latex = \\frac{1}{9}\\times 9 = 1\\ day&s=1$
$latex \\therefore Required\\ Time\\ = 10+1=11\\ days$
Hence option [C] is correct answer.
